item.title: Halcyon Happenings: Newsletter 174
item.description:
Personal Projects: a Glimpse of Olivia’s Project

Our G10 students are working away on finalising their Personal Projects. Yesterday, as part of Olivia’s Personal Project, she organised an exhibition of her paintings with philosophical questions:

"For my personal project I organised an art exhibition that was a form of self expression. The art pieces reflected what I’ve learnt from self studying the subject of philosophy and my intention was to get my community to ask themselves and each other philosophical questions and have discussions. I really appreciated all the feedback I got in the guest book. Thank you”
Celebrating World Book Week at Halcyon

World Book Day is Thursday 02 March and Halcyon will celebrate Book Week culminating in a dress up day on Friday 03 March! 

Here's a link to this year's schedule and some of last year's activities to whet your appetite and get you thinking about what costume you want to wear! Don't forget to buy or make your costume over the half term break!

Questions? Contact Jo Ranson.
Calling all students! Interested in becoming a Halcyon Digital Buddy?
Improve things. Together.
 

Are you passionate about using tech in your classrooms to support what you and your classmates are doing?  Do you like to be at the cutting edge of innovation?  Would you like to help the school position itself as THE number one digital learning school? Do videos like the one below excite you and make you want to inspire others?

If your answer is yes to all of the above, the role of Digital Buddy might just be the perfect fit for you! Come work alongside a team of enthusiastic students from all grade levels who will help shape the learning culture at Halcyon. The sort of things you might do: Genius Bar; Field Trips; Open House presentations; fast-tracked digital certification; run sessions for teachers and students, and more!

If you are interested in becoming a Digital Buddy, please complete the linked application form here. Mr Neale will be in touch before the end of the half term break to discuss the exciting next steps!
A Warm Farewell to our Argentinian Students!

Wednesday 15 February was the end of the exchange programme with our two Argentinian students Mati and Dioni. During one month, they had the chance to immerse themselves in Halcyon and London. For example, the transportation. As Mati explained ”when we separated from the group we took the Tube. This was a horrible experience, there were a lot of people and it was noisy, but it was something different and that is what I was expecting from this trip.”

To share their experience, Mati and Dioni had the brilliant idea to create a Google Site and detailed everything they discovered and how beneficial this exchange was for them. 

We would like to thank again our generous hosts, the Bodaghis and Schmidt Das families. We are delighted that this international experience is always a wonderful opportunity for everyone to grow, share and learn from each other!
Halcyon House of Horror - Selection of Scenes

Halcyon Students from G6 - G10 worked together to build a drama ensemble for the first part of the year. Then, they began working on their actual performance scenes. The theme of the overall show was based on horror, to look at the dark side of life. The students performed in a Traverse Theatre space, where the audience sits on both sides of the stage. This type of stage was challenging, but also interesting. Audience member, Beckett commented, 'The play was extremely impressive and interesting to watch.' Many thanks to students, staff and parents for attending. By Lucy G10
More University Acceptances & Offers

Central Saint Martins
Dickinson College
University of San Diego
SUNY Geneseo

This includes merit scholarship offers totalling £300,000! 

Watch this list as it grows and wish our G12 students well! 
 
CyberFirst : An exciting competition to inspire and encourage girls to consider a career in cyber
“CyberFirst is designed to open up and introduce talented students to the possibilities of a career in cyber. We need young people from all backgrounds. In the UK currently only 10% of those working in cyber are women. This means the UK is missing out on an extraordinarily talented group of people. So CyberFirst is running a girl’s competition to inspire and encourage future generations of young women to consider a career in cyber."

If you want to learn more about this competition, follow this link.

Halcyon is keen to put a team together. For those who would like to participate, please write to Mr Howden. 

The online challenges will start on Monday 27 February and run until Monday 06 March 2017.
Adolescence in Perspective - Challenges for Teenagers and Parents
Date: Monday 27 February
Time: 1900
Location: Halcyon Hub
Halcyon will host an evening for parents to learn about the challenges facing our teenagers and the strategies that we can employ to support them. 
The session will be run by Heli Sarin-Yates an experienced Dialectical Behavioural Therapy (DBT) therapist and Elizabeth Howell a parent counsellor with a special interest in supporting parents through their journey with their teenage daughters and sons. 
Come and learn strategies that are more likely to result in positive outcomes.
Please use this form to RSVP.
Questions? Contact Gareth Jones.

Halcyon Quiz Night and Auction - Save the Date!
Date: Thursday, 30 March 2017
Time: 1900 - 2200

Join us for an evening of fun, trivia and prizes for Halcyon’s first ever digital Quiz Night and Auction! These events are designed to bring our community together, have a great time and raise funds for our exciting renovation, Learning Reimagined. 

Eventbrite tickets to go on sale Wednesday 01 March!

Any questions or want to get involved? Contact Rita Halbright
3-Way Conferences - Save the Date

Families with surnames A-K | Thursday 16 March from 15.30-18.30
Families with surnames L-Z | Monday 20 March from 15.30-18.30
“The philosophy and open mindedness [at Halcyon], have totally removed the “red tape” and “tick box” cultures which I was accustomed to for so many years. “ George Elia
HPC Monthly Drop In Meeting
Date: Wednesday 15 March
Time: 0900
Location: Bernardi's, Seymour Place
Please stop by to keep up with the latest parent community news and to have a cup of coffee.  Questions? Contact Berna Hudson.

item.title: Halcyon Happenings: Newsletter 173
item.description:
Dear Parents, Students and Staff,

NEASC Accreditation Leaders Trillium Hibbeln and Devin Pratt spent this week examining how Halcyon meets the ACE Protocol, NEASC’s new set of criteria. ACE is a new and innovative standard which assesses the learning and community impacts as compared to the more traditional box-ticking assessment oft used by other accreditation organisations. Trillium and Devin spent a good deal of their time observing and meeting with students, staff and parents. While we must wait for the actual report to share their findings, I think the following anecdote from Devin will give you a sense of what to expect.

When asked, “Can you tell us one thing you see happening here at Halcyon that you would love to see another school do?” Devin told the story of his former, large IB school (2000+ students) where he worked on a rigorous research project to define what their school would need to do to be “cutting-edge”. Over a one year period 21 teachers from within the school conducted three international trips to visit highly acclaimed schools identified as being innovative, focusing on each of their unique qualities. The culmination of their research was a white paper presented to their school board supporting their recommendation on what their school needed to implement to become cutting-edge.

Devin added, “and Halcyon is already doing them all.”

Sometimes we are all so busy we don’t take the time to look at the wonderful, life-readying and innovative learning happening here at Halcyon. We need to have external, objective observers share with us what they see. Thanks to Devin and Trillium we had a chance to reflect. And we are grateful to our students, teachers and parents who help make it all happen

We look forward to sharing the results of the NEASC report with you when it arrives in the next 4-6 weeks. Have an enjoyable weekend.

Warm regards,
ISA Testing for MYP Students - Reminder

Tuesday 14 Feb
0900 - 1220, ISA Tests Part 1, G6 - G10

Wednesday 15 February
0905 - 1135 ISA Tests Part 2, G6 - G10
1135 - 1230 ISA Science Tests, G7 - G10

Students in Grades 6-10 will take the ISA reading, writing and math tests on the mornings of Tuesday 14 February and Wednesday 15 February. Students in Grades 7-10 will also take the  scientific literacy test on 15 February. 

The ISA tests are online tests that can be accessed on an iPad or on a laptop. Students do not need to bring any special materials, but will need: 

  • a fully charged device (required) 
  • a keyboard for their iPad (optional)
Students whose first language is not English may use a translating dictionary and should bring:
a paper dictionary (electronic dictionaries NOT allowed). 

You will get a report on your child's results, but the tests do not contribute to students' IBMYP term grades and are not included in transcripts. If you have any questions, please contact  Lori Fritz, MYP Coordinator.
Celebrating World Book Week at Halcyon

World Book Day is on Thursday 02 March. A variety of events will be taking place in English lessons and around the school. The week will culminate in a dress-up day on Friday 03 March.

See the blog articles below for some of last year's activities in the hope that it will wet your appetite and get you thinking about what costume you want to wear! 

World Book Week - Day One
World Book Week - Day Two
World Book Week - Days Three and Four
World Book Week - Day Five

If you would like to be involved in the organisation and planning or have any ideas/suggestions please contact Jo Ranson.
 
Drama Club Performance
Date: Wednesday 15 February
Time: 1730-2030
Location: Halcyon, Media Room

Support the Halcyon drama club by attending their ensemble performance directed and produced by the cast of students! The audience can expect to be immersed in a series of short scenes exploring the darker side of human nature.

PLEASE NOTE: there is limited audience space so tickets will be allocated on a first come first served basis and cast members are only allowed two guests each. To RSVP please email Kelly Foster.
Apple Regional Training Session
“You can get stuck using an app in one way and the training really helped me see new ways to use apps we already have.” Halcyon teacher

Halcyon held its first training session as Apple’s Regional Training Centre (education) this week and is already receiving lovely feedback. Educators from the UK and Europe came to attend the useful workshop as well as some of our own teachers. Facilitators Neil Emery and Ben Stanley designed a number of interesting tasks, including “The Murder at Tatton Hall” which got everyone thinking about how to use Showbie, Soundboard Studio, Adobe Spark, GoPro Quik, Padlets and QR Scanner in new and different ways. To get a sense of the day, watch this video.

If you were unable to attend this session, there are still places available on the Google Training below.
London Google Educator Bootcamp
Date: Tuesday 28 February
Time: 0915 - 1545
Location: Halcyon

Get certified, WIN a Chromebook, and learn about the greatest educational tools at the first London Google Educator Bootcamp! Bootcamps provide engaging learning experiences in a digital environment and a path to become an official Google Certified Educator. All attendees will be provided with a voucher to take the exam for FREE following the bootcamp. To ensure the quality of the training, please note that we are limiting the number of registrations. Head over to http://london.appsevents.com/ and secure your spot ASAP. 

While these training opportunities are geared toward educators they provide excellent digital insights so we are opening them up to our parent community as well.

Questions? Please email Jon Neale.
 
A Guardian video editing workshop video made by Halcyon students
Video Editing Workshop

Last week G9 students and students from Halcyonite (the school’s e-magazine) gained an insight into what it is like to be a video editor at the Guardian by working on multimedia content for the Guardian’s website. Students were given a theme of ‘climate change’ for their videos; they edited and produced fantastic videos. The video attached above was made by Nikhita and Reka.
Discover more about the Learning Reimagined campaign by watching this video!
Development News

Learning Reimagined…Watch The Video and Imagine!
We are delighted to report that thanks to a few, recent very generous gifts we are just below the £110,000 mark. We are greatly encouraged by your support but we have a way to go!

Please consider how you might wish to get involved and support Halcyon’s development projects whether through time, auction prizes or resources. All forms of support are valuable to helping Halcyon deliver above and beyond! Please contact Rita Halbright for questions or to get involved or make a donation. Thank you.
Digital Quiz Night / Auction
Are you looking for a fun and collaborative way to support Halcyon’s next development event? Please consider working with the Digital Quiz Team. This is an evening where, thanks to students, we will participate in a traditional quiz night with a Halcyon twist - DIGITAL and CREATIVE. Not your ordinary quiz night. You'll have fun and understand the allure of app engagement even more. We are still looking for organisers and auction prizes. It will be a fantastic evening, but we need to expand our team. Please contact Rita Halbright to learn what is in store. You are guaranteed to learn a lot, enjoy yourself and get to know our community better.
Word of Mouth Workshop

“[It] really helped me understand Halcyon's strategy when it comes to growing the school.  It was encouraging to hear that Halcyon has been able to meet its growth targets in a sustainable and economical way.  I never stopped to think about how powerful word of mouth recommendations are compared to traditional methods of advertising.” Halcyon Parent

Halcyon held a workshop this week for a number of parents on the power of word-of-mouth. 

-84% of consumers say they trust either completely or strongly recommendations from family, colleagues, and friends. 

-74% identify personal recommendations as a key influencer in their purchasing decisions.

Word-of-mouth recommendation is our largest source of inquiries for student places - 27% more than regular internet searches. And they are highly effective and free!

If you would like to learn more, please contact Rita Halbright. Any personal introductions to your child(ren)’s previous school, your embassy, educational consultant or employer are most appreciated. Bring a friend to an Open House or review us on line. 
 
HPC Monthly Drop In Meeting
Date: Wednesday 15 February
Time: 0900
Location: Bernardi's, Seymour Place
Please stop by to keep up with the latest parent community news and to have a cup of coffee.  Questions? Contact Berna Hudson.

item.title: Halcyon Happenings: Newsletter 171
item.description:
Halcyon students and staff on the Google Stage at BETT last week!
British Biology Olympiad Competition
Erin, Ethan, Fra, Noah and Vicky in G11 entered the prestigious British Biology Olympiad competition. They participated in this demanding competition last week by sitting two one hour multiple choice papers that challenged their knowledge of a range of topics covered in the DP Biology syllabus. They were competing with students from all across the UK including some first year university students. We extend congratulations for taking on the challenge!
International Input For Our Spring - Summer Menu
Our Catering Manager, Sonia Cross, would really like to hear from you with recipe ideas from your home country. Whether it's a soup, salad, main course or dessert, please send in your suggestions to scross@halcyonschool.com.

Please make sure your recipe ideas lend themselves to our vegetarian cuisine and can easily be made for large groups.
15 Halcyon Students to be Published
Young Writers’ Competition
MYP English students recently entered the Young Writers’ latest mini saga competition, called 'Welcome to Wonderland' and we are delighted to announce that 15 Halcyon students are soon to be published writers! Watch this space for the book once it is published on 30 April 2017.

If your child is being published a letter will have been sent to you. Please remember to give permission for the work to be included in the book – you do not have to order a copy, but you do have to give your consent for the work to be published. Please refer to the letter you received to see how to give permission, make any changes to the typeset proof and/or name and please adhere to the specified  deadline. Questions? Email Jo Ranson.

Published pupils then have a chance of winning a prize, plus the top schools win prizes too. We’ve thoroughly enjoyed taking part in this competition; pupils have been inspired and motivated. 
We are delighted for Jonah, Grade 8 who won a bronze medal in the LSAA Cross-Country Championships this week! Jonah completed the 3.5 km race in 11minutes. Congratulations Jonah!
Halcyon’s Model United Nations (MUN) Conference
Date: Thursday 23 and Friday 24 March
Time: 0900-1700
Location: Halcyon
Halcyon’s student-led MUN Conference is fast approaching! MUN is a key part of Halcyon’s student community - it is the largest club at the school!  For the conference, each student is assigned a country and placed in a committee. In these committees, an issue of global importance is debated, with the purpose of creating a resolution that addresses the issue. Students have to debate the issue and create this resolution, from the perspective of their assigned country. More information about the Halcyon conference can be found on the website. 

The theme of our 2017 conference is ‘Cooperation in an Increasingly Globalised World’, and we feel that Halcyon’s parent community has a lot to offer in terms of interesting and relevant speakers. If there are any embassy parents or other parents who would be interested in coming to speak during the opening ceremony on 23 March or the closing ceremony on 24 March, please email the Board of Directors at modelun@halcyonschool.com for more information. 

For Halcyon students who are interested in attending, the sign-up sheet can be found here, and the chairing application form is here. 

Best Wishes, 
Halcyon MUN Board of Directors,
Alexi, Ava, Ellie, Eric, Ethan, Fra, Evy, Kieran, Maggie, Nate, Nathan and Scott. 
G6 Pharmaceutical Experiments
Grade 6 have been working very hard on their own experimental designs to investigate which antacid relieves heartburn the quickest. They have also been experimenting to see if baking soda can be used instead of antacid tablets.
Community Digital Training Opportunities

Apple (iOS) Training
Date: Thursday 09 February
Time: 0915 - 1545
Location: Halcyon
We invite our community to the 2017 Halcyon Central London RTC workshop. A day of FREE training, facilitated by Apple Education Trainers, this workshop will showcase must-have apps for learners and demonstrate workflows. All delegates will gain skills to amass high quality evidence of understanding and also ways in which independent learning from students can be encouraged. Bring your iPad, or we can lend you one for the day. Please visit this link for more information and to register.

London Google Educator Bootcamp
Date: Tuesday 28 February
Time: 0915 - 1545
Location: Halcyon
Get certified, WIN a Chromebook, and learn about the greatest educational tools at the first London Google Educator Bootcamp! Bootcamps provide engaging learning experiences in a digital environment and a path to become an official Google Certified Educator. All attendees will be provided with a voucher to take the exam for FREE following the bootcamp. To ensure the quality of the training, please note that we are limiting the number of registrations. Head over to http://london.appsevents.com/ and secure your spot ASAP. 

While these training opportunities are geared toward educators they provide excellent digital insights so we are opening them up to our parent community as well.

Questions? Please email Jon Neale.
Save The Date!
NEASC Presentation to Halcyon Community
Date: Wednesday 08 February
Time: 1615-1715
Location: Halcyon
During the week of 06 February Halcyon will be visited by the NEASC’s (New England Association of Schools and Colleges) accreditation team - Trillium G. Hibbeln (NEASC - Burlington MA, USA)
And Devin Pratt (Frankfurt International School). This visit marks another important milestone in our growth and development! The visit will support and improve our learning and give the school additional recognition with US universities as well as the international education community. Trillium and Devin are hosting a presentation for the whole Halcyon community (parents, students and staff) to inform everyone about the process - this is an excellent opportunity for members of our community to ask questions and engage with our school’s development. We encourage everyone to attend and celebrate this milestone! RSVP here.
Development News

Learning Reimagined…Watch The Video and Imagine!
We are delighted to report that thanks to a few, recent very generous gifts we are just below the £110,000 mark. We are greatly encouraged by your support but we have a way to go!

Please consider how you might wish to get involved and support Halcyon’s development projects whether through time, auction prizes or resources. All forms of support are valuable to helping Halcyon deliver above and beyond! Please contact Rita Halbright for questions or to get involved. Thank you.
Discover more about the Learning Reimagined campaign by watching this video!
Digital Quiz Night / Auction
Are you looking for a fun and collaborative way to support Halcyon’s next development event? Please consider working with the Digital Quiz Team. This is an evening where, thanks to students, we will participate in a traditional quiz night with a Halcyon twist - DIGITAL and CREATIVE. Not your ordinary quiz night. You'll have fun and understand the allure of app engagement even more. We are still looking for organisers and auction prizes. It will be a fantastic evening, but we need to expand our team. Please contact Rita Halbright to learn what is in store. You are guaranteed to learn a lot, enjoy yourself and get to know our community better.
Learn More About The Power of Word-of-Mouth Marketing
Date: See Doodle Form and Sign-Up!
Location: Halcyon
We would like to thank our parents who continue to recommend Halcyon to new families and invite all parents to join us for an engaging workshop on the power of word-of-mouth marketing. Word-of-mouth recommendations are rated highest when it comes to trustworthiness in people’s decision-making.

This informative workshop will review Halcyon's approach to marketing, our customer experience and where and how our parents are helping to grow the Halcyon community.

Please take a look at this doodle form and sign-up for a slot that works for you. We will then confirm the most popular date and time. Thank you again for being such wonderful promoters of Halcyon and we look forward to seeing you soon!
HPC Monthly Drop In Meeting
Date: Wednesday 15 February
Time: 0900
Location: Bernardi's, Seymour Place
Please stop by to keep up with the latest parent community news and to have a cup of coffee.  Questions? Contact Berna Hudson.

Halcyon students and staff on the Google Stage at BETT last week!
British Biology Olympiad Competition
Erin, Ethan, Fra, Noah and Vicky in G11 entered the prestigious British Biology Olympiad competition. They participated in this demanding competition last week by sitting two one hour multiple choice papers that challenged their knowledge of a range of topics covered in the DP Biology syllabus. They were competing with students from all across the UK including some first year university students. We extend congratulations for taking on the challenge!
International Input For Our Spring - Summer Menu
Our Catering Manager, Sonia Cross, would really like to hear from you with recipe ideas from your home country. Whether it's a soup, salad, main course or dessert, please send in your suggestions to scross@halcyonschool.com.

Please make sure your recipe ideas lend themselves to our vegetarian cuisine and can easily be made for large groups.
15 Halcyon Students to be Published
Young Writers’ Competition
MYP English students recently entered the Young Writers’ latest mini saga competition, called 'Welcome to Wonderland' and we are delighted to announce that 15 Halcyon students are soon to be published writers! Watch this space for the book once it is published on 30 April 2017.

If your child is being published a letter will have been sent to you. item.description:

We are delighted to report that thanks to a few, recent very generous gifts we are just below the £110,000 mark. We are greatly encouraged by your support but we have a way to go!

Please consider how you might wish to get involved and support Halcyon’s development projects whether through time, auction prizes or resources. All forms of support are valuable to helping Halcyon deliver above and beyond! Please contact Rita Halbright for questions or to get involved. Thank you.
Discover more about the Learning Reimagined campaign by watching this video!
Digital Quiz Night / Auction
Are you looking for a fun and collaborative way to support Halcyon’s next development event? Please consider working with the Digital Quiz Team. This is an evening where, thanks to students, we will participate in a traditional quiz night with a Halcyon twist - DIGITAL and CREATIVE. Not your ordinary quiz night. You'll have fun and understand the allure of app engagement even more. We are still looking for organisers and auction prizes. It will be a fantastic evening, but we need to expand our team. Please contact Rita Halbright to learn what is in store. You are guaranteed to learn a lot, enjoy yourself and get to know our community better.
“Bravo - great event and fun launch.” - Parent. Read all about our first speaker series event!
Photos From The Explorations Showcase
International Input for our Spring - Summer Menu
Our Catering Manager, Sonia Cross, would really like to hear from you with recipe ideas from your home country. Whether it's a soup, salad, main course or dessert, please send in your suggestions to scross@halcyonschool.com.

Please make sure your recipe ideas lend themselves to our vegetarian cuisine and can easily be made for large groups.
Halcyon Success at #BETT2017
Today four of our students presented on the Google stage at Bett 2017 along with English teacher Ross McGowan and Digital Learning Leader Jon Neale. This was a fantastic opportunity for our students to showcase their public speaking skills and demonstrate to the EdTech community how they feel digital integration, with a specific focus on the new Google sites platform, has helped to transform their learning. 

Becket and Ellery (G10) represented Halcyon’s Student Council. The Student Council created a website to further develop student voice using Google Sites. They presented to the BETT audience the benefits of implementing a Google site website:
  • Student Council availability to the community 24/7
  • Meetings more attuned to students
  • Noticeable improvement in overall communication amongst Student Council and with community
  • Greater transparency in communications, setting meeting agendas, etc.
  • Easy implementation of Google forms and docs
Overall, Ellery and Beckett emphasised how integrating this digital tool improved their organisation and interaction with the wider student community. 

Ellie and Noah (G11) showcased their fantastic student-led and student created e-magazine - The Halcyonite. The Halcyonite team also opted for a Google site as their platform. Their presentation featured a live demonstration of their first published e-zine. The main benefits of the platform for them are:
  • Easy to use
  • Visually attractive
  • Allows for collaboration - all contributors were able to work on the same platform at the same time
  • Responsive design - works well across all devices- from tablet to smartphone to desktop
Ross McGowan and Jon Neale showcased separately how the new Google Sites platform has been revolutionising the way things are done at Halcyon; both in and out of the classroom. 

Tens of thousands of people from all over the world attended the show; it was a huge honour for Halcyon to present on the Google Stage. 
We also had the pleasure of meeting Jonathan Rochelle, co-founder of Google Docs and Google Drive! 
See The Schools Halcyon Students Have Come From!
G9 and G10 Parents' University Information Evening
Date: Tuesday 31 January
Time: 1830-1930
Location: Halcyon
All G9 and G10 parents and students are encouraged to attend this information workshop hosted by Mark Bowen, University Counsellor. Mark will be discussing the University Counselling Programme here at Halcyon as well as the timeline and tips for what students and parents can be doing in preparation for the application process in G12. Please RSVP here. Questions? Please email Mark.
Learn More About The Power of Word-of-Mouth Marketing
Date: Wednesday 08 February
Location: Halcyon
We would like to thank our parents who continue to recommend Halcyon to new families and invite all parents to join Rita and Eilidh for an engaging workshop on the power of Word-of-Mouth marketing. Together with the internet, word-of-mouth recommendations rank highest for Halcyon's new and prospective families.

This informative workshop will review Halcyon's approach to marketing, our customer experience and where and how our parents are helping to grow the Halcyon community. Plus, being together with other parents is a great way to hear about how others promote the school.

Please take a look at this doodle form and sign-up for a time slot that work for you. We will then confirm the most popular time. Thank you again for being such wonderful promoters of Halcyon and we look forward to seeing you on 08 Feb.
Charity Run For Cancer Research UK
Date: Wednesday 15 March
Time: 1630-1830
Location: Hyde Park
Daphni (G12) and Evy (G10) would like to invite you to participate in a student-led charity run in aid of Cancer Research UK. Parents, students and staff are encouraged to sign-up!

Runners have the option of a 5km or 10km track. If you would like to participate by running, helping, or donating please complete this form.

item.title: Tube Strike Update
item.description:
Good morning,

Please be aware that train operators who are RMT members are planning to strike. If this strike action goes ahead, it will affect services on Thursday 26 January, as follows:
  • On the Central line, no service east of Leytonstone and a reduced service running on the rest of the line all day
  • No Waterloo and City line services all day
Central and Waterloo and City line services will finish between 30 and 60 minutes earlier than usual on Wednesday evening, so please check before you travel. 

All other TfL services will be unaffected, but other lines and stations are likelier to be busier than usual. Santander Cycles will be available as normal. 

For the latest information, please visit tfl.gov.uk/tube-strike or follow @TfLTravelAlerts, @TfLTrafficNews and @TfLBusAlerts on Twitter.

Best wishes,
The Halcyon Team

item.title: Halcyon Happenings: Newsletter 169
item.description:
Reminder: Thursday 26 January is a half-day for students! There will be no afternoon classes.
Exchange Programme: ¡¡Bienvenidos Mati y Dioni!! 
On Tuesday 17 January we were thrilled to welcome two Argentinian exchange students to Halcyon - Mati and Dioni! This visit is part of our student Language Exchange Programme with St. Ignatius College in Argentina - some of you might remember our first exchange programme student, Pauli, from last year. This is an international experience we are proud to offer Halcyon students and students from St Ignatius!

We hope to immerse Mati and Dioni fully in Halcyon and London life during their one month visit: from academic to social opportunities. We want to extend a big thank you to their generous host families - the Bodaghi’s and the Schmidt-Das’. We are sure Halcyon students Matis and Kieran will be the perfect 'cicerone mates' for them, along with the rest of students from Grade 10 and 11.

A number of Halcyon students (Eric, Kieran and Nate from G11 and Beckett, Lucia, Matis, Maggie, and Olivia from G10) went to Gatwick on Tuesday to give them a warm welcome after their long trip (see the photo below). On Wednesday Halcyon put on a delicious spread as a welcome breakfast after which our Argentinian peers were given their lesson plan and had a tour of the school. 

On Thursday we held an assembly where Dioni and Mati discussed their school in Argentina and Rio Cuarto, their home town. Eric, Kieran and Nate who went to Argentina in the summer with the exchange programme also shared their experience of the exchange programme. The whole school then participated in an online quiz which tested vocabulary differences between Spanish language in Argentina with Spain. 

We are positive Mati and Dioni will fully integrate themselves in Halcyon life and look forward to supporting them during this fantastic journey.
#BETT2017: Halcyon Presentations
Date: Friday 27 January
Time: 1030
Location: ExCel London
Like Halcyon, BETT believes in creating a better future by transforming education. Their mission is to bring together people, ideas, practices and technologies so that educators and learners can fulfil their potential. Every year, at the ExCel Arena, they host BETTshow - the world’s largest education technology event.  

Tens of thousands of people from all over the world attend the show; this year promises to be bigger and better than ever before. It is therefore a huge honour that Halcyon has been asked to present on the Google Stage at 1030 on Friday 27 January. 

Students and staff will be explaining how the new Google Sites platform has been revolutionising the way that things are done at Halcyon; both in and out of the classroom. Student representatives will be joining from the Halcyonite (Halcyon’s student-led e-magazine) and from the Student Council to talk about some of the innovative ways they are using this awesome interactive tool! If you would like to attend BETT, register at bettshow.com. Follow @HalcyonSchool on Twitter to keep apprised of #BETT2017 news and updates!
Rachel in G12 presenting on the Google stage for Halcyon last year at BETT2016.
Save The Date: Halcyon’s First Graduation
Date: Sat 27 May 2017
Location: TBC
We invite our entire community to join us for our first graduation ceremony! It will be a day to remember as we celebrate our eight pioneers and wish them well for the next chapters of their exciting journeys. 
Register for Choir Club!
Date: Every Wednesday
Time: 1610-1700
Location: Halcyon
We are delighted to announce that West End performer Amanda Posener will be running a choir club at Halcyon. Amanda has been in many West end shows including The Lion King, Dancing in the Streets and Avenue Q. The club will be singing many different styles from pop to musical theatre!

Price per session will be £10 - payment method to agree personally with Amanda. 

Please get in contact with Amanda to express your interest and get more information: mandascaramanda@hotmail.com.

Furthermore, Amanda will be available for individual lessons on request.
Art Teacher, Sue Dance, shared this wonderful drawing by Sadie in G6. Sadie drew this in her Art Studio Skills Exploration. Sue said that Sadie always sets herself the goal to develop her observational skills to a very high level.  Everyone in the class loved her drawing. Well done!
HPC: Women’s March on London
Many Halcyon parents with their children will be participating in tomorrow’s Women’s March on London. If you would like to join them please contact Stacey Ciauri on 07557520442. 
Save The Date!
NEASC Presentation to Halcyon Community
Date: Wednesday 08 February
Time: 1615-1715
Location: Halcyon
During the week of 06 February Halcyon will be visited by the NEASC’s (New England Association of Schools and Colleges) accreditation team - Trillium G. Hibbeln (NEASC - Burlington MA, USA)
And Devin Pratt (Frankfurt International School). This visit marks another important milestone in our growth and development! The visit will support and improve our learning and give the school additional recognition with US universities as well as the international education community. Trillium and Devin are hosting a presentation for the whole Halcyon community (parents, students and staff) to inform everyone about the process - this is an excellent opportunity for members of our community to ask questions and engage with our school’s development. We encourage everyone to attend and celebrate this milestone! RSVP here.
Hyde Park at Lunch for Grades 6, 7 and 8
At Halcyon we recognise that promoting an active lifestyle is important to being fit and healthy. Longitudinal research in the British Journal of Sports Medicine shows that greater participation in physical activity has a positive impact on academic achievement (Booth et al., 2013). 

Starting next week, Halcyon will introduce Hyde Park lunch sessions for Grades 6, 7 and 8. Once a week, each grade will have a full hour for lunch - beginning 15 minutes earlier than normal at 1200 - to provide them with the opportunity to go to Hyde Park with Fit for Sport. Once at Hyde Park students will be able to participate in activities such as ultimate frisbee and football. The Hyde Park lunch time activity for each grade will take place on a different day each week and will be weather dependent. If it is raining students will remain on campus. The day of each grade’s Hyde Park visit will be communicated to students in the Morning Notes. 

On those days, students should bring a change of trainers just in case they get muddy in the park. 

We will monitor the success of the programme over the coming weeks with a view to extending this opportunity to Grades 9 and 10. Ultimately, we wish to offer all students, Grades 6 - 10, greater access to outdoor activities.

At lunchtime,we will also be developing a more diverse range activities within the school. In the Stern Hall, Fit for Sport will run a weekly rotation of activities such as dodgeball and hockey for students to participate in. In the Second Floor Space, students can relax with friends, read a book or get support from teachers with their homework.

The overall aim of the increased lunch time provision is to provide more opportunities for students to have an active and social lunch time at Halcyon. This in turn will support a positive impact on our children’s health and learning.

If you have any questions please email Gareth Jones.
University Updates and Reminders

G11 University Admissions Information Evening
Date: Tuesday 24 January
Time: 1830-2000
Location: Halcyon
G11 parents please register here. Questions? Please email Mark Bowen.


G9 and 10 Parents' University Information Evening
Date: Tuesday 31 January
Time: 1830-1930
Location: Halcyon
All G9 and 10 parents are encouraged to attend this information workshop hosted by Mark Bowen. Mark will be discussing the University Counselling Programme here at Halcyon as well as the timeline and tips for what students and parents can be doing in preparation for the application process in G12. Please RSVP here. Questions? Please email Mark.
Join us for our new ‘Inspiring Voices’ speaker series!
Young, innovative, entrepreneurs will share their paths to success.

Date: Wednesday 25 January
Time: 1830 - 2000
Location: Halcyon
Cost: £15 per adult and £5 for students and staff 
RSVP here.
Share this flyer with your friends, family and colleagues too!
What does success look like today? Join us for a thought-provoking evening where two young, innovative and inspiring entrepreneurs share their paths to success in the world of Artificial Intelligence! David Benigson, Co-founder, Signal Media and Eric D. Collins COO, Touch Surgery, have taken two very different journeys to get to where they are today.

Feed your mind and support Halcyon in one go, RSVP here. Questions? Email Rita Halbright.
David Benigson                    Eric D. Collins
Rescheduled Monthly HPC Drop in Meeting
Date: Tuesday 24 January
Time: 0900
Location: Bernardis, Seymour Place
Questions? Please email Berna Hudson.

Director: Barry Mansfield
IBMYP Coordinator: Lori Fritz
IBDP Coordinator: Pat Kyle

item.title: Halcyon Happenings: Newsletter 168
item.description:
University Offers 
Halcyon is pleased to announce some of our first university acceptances and offers:
  • City, University of London
  • Loyola Marymount University
  • Marist College
  • Santa Clara University
  • Royal Holloway, University of London
  • Temple University Japan
  • University of Cambridge
  • University of Roehampton
  • University of Surrey
  • University of Warwick
  • University of Westminster
  • University of York
This includes scholarship offers totalling USD 125,000! 

Watch this list as it grows and wish our G12 students well for their IBDP Mock exams later this month.
EdTech Innovators
Halcyon have once again been asked to present on the Google Stage at BETT, the world's largest education technology exhibition. Students and staff will be showcasing some of our recent Google Sites projects that are improving learning, organisation and collaboration. We are presenting on Friday 27 January at 1030. 

We highly recommend you consider attending BETT in any event and you will definitely enjoy and learn from our student presentations. If you would like to attend, please secure your free ticket here. More information to follow in the next couple of weeks. Don't forget to follow @halcyonschool on Twitter for updates throughout #BETT2017.
Join us for our new ‘Inspiring Voices’ speaker series!
Young, innovative, entrepreneurs will share their paths to success.

Date: Wednesday 25 January
Time: 1830 - 2000
Location: Halcyon
Cost: £15 per adult and £5 for students and staff 
RSVP here.
Share this flyer with your friends, family and colleagues too!
What does success look like today? Join us for a thought-provoking evening where two young, innovative and inspiring entrepreneurs share their paths to success in the world of Artificial Intelligence. David Benigson, Co-founder, Signal Media and Eric Collins COO, Touch Surgery, have taken two very different journeys to get to where they are today.

Feed your mind and support Halcyon in one go, RSVP here. Questions? Email Rita Halbright.
David Benigson             Eric Collins
Did you know word-of-mouth is the most effective form of marketing? Tell your friends and colleagues about Halcyon. Our next Open House morning on Tuesday 17 January is now FULL! Find more dates here.
G10 Parents and Students: Introduction to IBDP
Date: Tuesday 17 January
Time: 1730-1830
Location: Halcyon
At this session parents and students will learn about the IB Diploma Programme and how best to make Diploma course selections to support a student's current interests and future goals. The course selection process for G10 students begins in February 2017. 

We look forward to seeing all of the G10 parents and students, as well as any other members of the community who are interested in learning more about the Diploma Programme. Please contact Pat Kyle for further information. 
Save The Date: Explorations Showcase
Date: Friday 20 January
Time: 1430-1600
Location: Halcyon
Explorations form a new and incremental part of Halcyon’s learning experience. Our students now have the opportunity to explore courses of a more vocational nature while collaborating with students from across the MYP, Grades 6-10. Our Explorations form an important part of Halcyon’s approach to life-readying education where students have the opportunity to learn about different areas of interest in a more integrated way. From a wellbeing perspective, students also benefit from supporting one another and learning from students of different ages. Lastly, this gives our teachers the opportunity to share additional passions and expertise with our community.

Please come to the Exploration Showcase to enjoy the learning first hand, RSVP here.
Development News: Learning Reimagined and More
Have you considered how you can support our latest fundraising campaign: Learning Reimagined? Watch our video here and get inspired:
There is a great deal of activity going on with our committee - with exciting events coming up such as the Inspiring Voices Speaker’s Series. Please contact Rita Halbright, Development Director, if you would like to donate time or resources or join one of our teams who are planning our digital quiz night and exciting auction.
Monthly HPC Drop in Meeting
Date: Wednesday 18 January
Time: 0900
Location: Bernardis, Seymour Place
Questions? Please email Berna Hudson.

Calendar
Directory

Director: Barry Mansfield
IBMYP Coordinator: Lori Fritz

item.title: Halcyon Happenings: Newsletter 167
item.description:
Happy new year! We look forward to seeing everyone on Monday 09 January at 0900.
 
Please be aware that a tube strike has been proposed by TfL for Monday 09 January. Find affected services and updates here.
Save The Date: Explorations Showcase
Date: Friday 20 January
Time: 1430-1600
Location: Halcyon
Explorations form a new and incremental part of Halcyon’s learning experience. Our students now have the opportunity to explore courses of a more vocational nature while collaborating with students from across the MYP, Grades 6-10. Our Explorations form an important part of Halcyon’s approach to life-readying education where students have the opportunity to learn about different areas of interest in a more integrated way. From a wellbeing perspective, students also benefit from supporting one another and learning from students of different ages. Lastly, this gives our teachers a unique opportunity to share additional passions and expertise with our community.

Please come to the Exploration Showcase to enjoy the learning first hand, RSVP here.
Extracurricular Activities - Final Call!
We all highly value our Extracurricular Activities (ECA) offerings as they broaden and enrich our students’ learning and leisure activities here at Halcyon. To provide these in the most efficient manner, we publish the ECA offerings prior to the end of the previous term to allow for timely signups so sessions can begin as soon as students return to school.

Unfortunately, the deadline for signing-up has passed, despite reminders we have had less than 50% response rate. This makes it very difficult for the school to confirm activities that rely on minimum numbers and organise arrangements with outside providers.

May we ask that all parents and students who have yet to review the ECA offerings do so asap here. Please note that students will not be allowed to attend a club unless they have registered in advance. And many thanks to families who have already signed up!

Pending sufficient sign-up, Morning Energy Dance Class and LAMDA will start on Monday 16 January. 
Reminder - G10 'Parents and Students: Introduction to IBDP'
Date: Tuesday 17 January
Time: 1730-1830
Location: Halcyon
We look forward to seeing all of the G10 students and parents there!
Term Dates 2017/18
Halcyon’s term dates for the academic year 2017/18 are now live and can be found here. Please also find a PDF version here for your convenience.
Development News: Halcyon's New ‘Inspiring Voices’ Speaker Series
Date: Wednesday 25 January
Time: 1830 - 2000
Location: Halcyon
Cost: £15 per adult and £5 for students and staff 
Halcyon's Development Committee is delighted to present to you the first event in an exciting series of inspiring speakers for students, parents, staff and friends. The focus is on speakers in their 20's and 30's and we hope they might be seen as alumni-type role models for our young school. The plan is to build the speakers series into a valued learning and community building experience for Halcyon and our friends for years to come. And their is the added benefit of supporting fundraising for our Learning Reimagined campaign to develop the second floor into an innovative learning space for our students and for future campaigns.

For our first event, we have two inspiring speakers. Entrepreneur David Benigson is only 28 years old and has already raised over £10 million in funding for his media company Signal. Using Artificial Intelligence (AI), Signal helps companies and brands make more informed decisions by turning down the noise and turning up the relevant signals. David’s journey through school, to university and to co-founding a AI driven start up is inspiring.
 
It is a journey about what he has overcome and not just about what he has achieved. A journey that blends science and art. 

David will be joined by Eric Collins who is an AI expert & COO of Touch Surgery. Eric has advised various start-up founders and has also been part of Obama’s small business advisory. Together their stories show that different paths can lead to success.
 
Drinks and snacks will be served. Please RSVP here and invite friends and students to join you. Get ready for a thought-provoking evening and support Halcyon.
David Benigson
Eric Collins
Monthly HPC Drop in Meeting
Date: Wednesday 18 January
Time: 0900
Location:Bernardis, Seymour Place
Questions? Please email Berna Hudson.

item.content:encoded:
Happy new year! We look forward to seeing everyone on Monday 09 January at 0900.
 
Please be aware that a tube strike has been proposed by TfL for Monday 09 January. Find affected services and updates here.
Save The Date: Explorations Showcase
Date: Friday 20 January
Time: 1430-1600
Location: Halcyon
Explorations form a new and incremental part of Halcyon’s learning experience. Our students now have the opportunity to explore courses of a more vocational nature while collaborating with students from across the MYP, Grades 6-10. Our Explorations form an important part of Halcyon’s approach to life-readying education where students have the opportunity to learn about different areas of interest in a more integrated way. From a wellbeing perspective, students also benefit from supporting one another and learning from students of different ages. Lastly, this gives our teachers a unique opportunity to share additional passions and expertise with our community.

Please come to the Exploration Showcase to enjoy the learning first hand, RSVP here.
Extracurricular Activities - Final Call!
We all highly value our Extracurricular Activities (ECA) offerings as they broaden and enrich our students’ learning and leisure activities here at Halcyon. To provide these in the most efficient manner, we publish the ECA offerings prior to the end of the previous term to allow for timely signups so sessions can begin as soon as students return to school.

Unfortunately, the deadline for signing-up has passed, despite reminders we have had less than 50% response rate. This makes it very difficult for the school to confirm activities that rely on minimum numbers and organise arrangements with outside providers.

May we ask that all parents and students who have yet to review the ECA offerings do so asap here. Please note that students will not be allowed to attend a club unless they have registered in advance. And many thanks to families who have already signed up!

Pending sufficient sign-up, Morning Energy Dance Class and LAMDA will start on Monday 16 January. 
Reminder - G10 'Parents and Students: Introduction to IBDP'
Date: Tuesday 17 January
Time: 1730-1830
Location: Halcyon
We look forward to seeing all of the G10 students and parents there!
Term Dates 2017/18
Halcyon’s term dates for the academic year 2017/18 are now live and can be found here. Please also find a PDF version here for your convenience.
Development News: Halcyon's New ‘Inspiring Voices’ Speaker Series
Date: Wednesday 25 January
Time: 1830 - 2000
Location: Halcyon
Cost: £15 per adult and £5 for students and staff 
Halcyon's Development Committee is delighted to present to you the first event in an exciting series of inspiring speakers for students, parents, staff and friends. The focus is on speakers in their 20's and 30's and we hope they might be seen as alumni-type role models for our young school. The plan is to build the speakers series into a valued learning and community building experience for Halcyon and our friends for years to come. And their is the added benefit of supporting fundraising for our Learning Reimagined campaign to develop the second floor into an innovative learning space for our students and for future campaigns.

For our first event, we have two inspiring speakers. Entrepreneur David Benigson is only 28 years old and has already raised over £10 million in funding for his media company Signal. Using Artificial Intelligence (AI), Signal helps companies and brands make more informed decisions by turning down the noise and turning up the relevant signals. David’s journey through school, to university and to co-founding a AI driven start up is inspiring.
 
It is a journey about what he has overcome and not just about what he has achieved. A journey that blends science and art. 

David will be joined by Eric Collins who is an AI expert & COO of Touch Surgery. Eric has advised various start-up founders and has also been part of Obama’s small business advisory. Together their stories show that different paths can lead to success.
 
Drinks and snacks will be served. Please RSVP here and invite friends and students to join you. Get ready for a thought-provoking evening and support Halcyon.
David Benigson
Eric Collins
Monthly HPC Drop in Meeting
Date: Wednesday 18 January
Time: 0900
Location:Bernardis, Seymour Place
Questions? Please email Berna Hudson.

item.title: Halcyon Happenings: Newsletter 166
item.description:
Dear Parents, Students and Colleagues,

The winter break is an important staging-post in the school year. It is the end of the long journey from August - from the warm, late summer, refreshed as we return from our vacation, to mid-winter and the shortest day of the year. There is a sense that the hardest part of the year is behind us, and we now look forward to the New Year, to the spring, and to the successful completion of all our endeavours!  

And this school year, the success we are thrilled to celebrate is Halcyon’s first graduating class! On the afternoon of Saturday 27 May, we will have our first graduation ceremony, and we would please ask you to make a note of this date in your diary; we would like our community to come together, to mark the occasion for the school and to honour our graduates who have been such bold ambassadors for Halcyon. These graduates are already receiving offers and acceptances from universities, in the UK, US and Japan. I would like to congratulate them all on completing what is maybe the hardest term in the Diploma Programme.

We can reflect on the successful changes we have made this year. Most importantly, we have extended the IB Diploma Programme into Grade 12, and appointed our first in-house university guidance counsellor, Dr Mark Bowen. We have pioneered the ‘Explorations’ Programme, which we will showcase for parents on Friday 20 January. We have also developed our Wellbeing Programme by adding mentoring this term. We have a new reporting system (four times a year) and we have re-styled our 3 way conferences to support learning.  Finally, we have also sought to expand our extracurricular services, before and after school. Lots of positive and exciting changes to our wonderful learning environment.

This term, Halcyon teachers have completed all the necessary evaluation documentation for an accreditation visit, in February 2017, by the New England Association of Schools and Colleges (NEASC). This will be another important milestone in the school’s growth, and it recognises our expertise, our institutional strength, and our commitment to learning. I would like to thank all my colleagues for their dedication to improving learning, every day, at Halcyon.

The Halcyon Parent Community has always been wonderfully supportive to our community, and I would like to thank all our parents for their engagement and feedback. I would like to extend a special thank you for the International Showcase - a fantastic way to bring everyone together and to celebrate Halcyon. Thank you to everyone who donated their time so generously to support Halcyon.

To round off, I would like to say a big thank you to all of our students who continue to showcase Halcyon’s values and aspirations. They continue to be leaders, innovators, thinkers, and creators; to support each other; and to challenge themselves and extend their learning. Well done!

Best wishes, and have a great vacation!
Final Call! Extracurricular Sign-Up and Update

ECA Sign-Up and Start Date
Deadline for sign-up extended to Monday 19 December! Activities start on Monday 09 January.

G6-8 Football Club
Please note that the G6-8 Football Club will run on Tuesday morning 0800-0850 not after school. The club will be run by Tewolde Hagos. Please email Tewolde if you have any questions.

Running Club
Will be on Friday’s 0800-0850 not during lunch. Please email Mr Costa if you have any questions.
Save The Date! Explorations Showcase on Friday 20 January 2017, 1430-1600. Parents are invited to Halcyon where students will share their learning. Please RSVP here.
International Showcase 2016
"It was such an amazing evening getting to meet my friend's families!" - Halcyon Student
Find out about the fantastic event and view the photo gallery here.
This week we brought our lessons to life with Google Expeditions!
A Halcyon Winter Wonderland
Teachers trumped with their festive jumpers!
Read the Halcyonite! Halcyon’s First Student Created E-zine
Staff Appreciation Breakfast
Thanks to the HPC for providing a wonderful staff appreciation breakfast!
Student Voice: Grade 10 Conference
Article Written by Maggie in G10
On Tuesday 13 December Halcyon G10 history students held a conference discussing sexual violence in conflict. Ms. Cooke's class has been studying sexual violence and its use as a weapon in times of war. Each of the four groups of students presenting studied one conflict where sexual violence was a feature, the focusing on:
  • Guatemala
  • Mau Mau
  • Nanjing
  • Rwanda
We were fortunate enough to have guest speakers present. The first guest speaker, Rebekah Read, works with a law firm that seeks for compensation from the government for victims of sexual torture. The second speaker, Kevin O'dell, works with a charity that sends people to Guatemala for education and awareness. Finally, Ellie, Fra and Scott from G11 joined the conference to speak about everyday sexism and how one can go about combating it. 

A student attendee said:

“The conference was a very enlightening experience, I cannot believe (that talking about) sexual violence is still taboo and goes unmentioned in most school curricula, my classmates and the guest speakers did a great job and I cannot wait to attend this conference again next year.”

Overall, the conference was a huge success, thank you to all the students, Ms. Cooke and supporting staff for making it all possible!
G10 conference organisers and speakers.
Date Change for G10! 
We have moved the date for the G10 ‘Parents and Students: Introduction to IBDP’ from Tuesday 10 January to Tuesday 17 January (same time 1730-1830). We look forward to seeing all of the G10 students and families there!
Development News: Save The Date!
Extending Learning Opportunities To Our Community And Beyond
Date: Thursday 25 January
Time: 1830 - 2000
Location: Halcyon
‘Re-imagine Learning’ - Halcyon's new speaker series - inspiring speakers for students, parents, staff and friends.
 
We are delighted to launch our speakers series with a special guest, David Benigson. David is founder of Signal, a media firm that uses Artificial Intelligence ( AI ) to help companies and brands make more informed decisions by turning down the noise and turning up the relevant signals. David’s journey through school to university and starting a business that has raised more than US$10 million in funding is inspiring. Learn what he has overcome and what he has achieved. He will be joined by another company founder and together their stories will help us re-imagine learning and show that many learning routes can lead to success.
 
More details on this first event and the upcoming dinners and events in the speakers series will be shared in the new year. There will be drinks and nibbles as we engage with David. Ticket prices: £15 per adult and £5 for students and staff  which will all be donated toward the renovation of the new learning space here at Halcyon. Please save the date and invite friends and students to join you. Get ready for an interesting evening and support Halcyon.
Monthly HPC Drop in Meeting
Date: Wednesday 18 January
Time: 0900
Location:Bernardis, Seymour Place
Questions? Please email Berna Hudson.

item.title: Halcyon Happenings: Newsletter 165
item.description:
Bringing Lessons To Life
Imagine visiting the bottom of the Barrier Reef, Buckingham Palace or even the surface of Mars all in one afternoon! With Google Expeditions, teachers can take their students on immersive virtual journeys to bring their lessons to life.

Google Expedition teams are visiting selected schools around the UK and Halcyon is one of them. The Google team will be visiting us on Tuesday 13 December. Alongside Google, Jon Neale will be running a session for parents at 1115. It would be wonderful to welcome as many parents as possible to see such a transformative use of technology. If you are interested, please let us know by completing this form.
Google Expeditions
Taking students around the world in virtual reality.
We hope you can attend our Grade 10 Conference on Tuesday 13 December. The conference will run from 0900-1215. If you are yet to RSVP please do so here.
Term Two Extracurricular Activities
View our wonderful selection of extracurricular activities (ECAs) for Term Two here. 

Our exciting and diverse variety of clubs builds on the curriculum to ensure that each student has the opportunity to discover and pursue other areas of passion and inspiration.
Please note the deadline for sign-up is Friday 16 December - Term One registration does not run over for Term Two. Students who are currently members of a club will need to re-register for Term Two. By signing-up to activities with an additional fee, parents are making a commitment to pay for the full term programme.

We might also be offering a dance class as part of our ECA programme for Term Two. Watch this space for more info!
Carol Singing
On Wednesday evening 11 Halcyon students took part in a carol concert at Forrester Court Residential Care Home in Paddington. In the build up to the event Claire in Grade 11 held singing practice sessions. The carolling was a fantastic experience for everyone involved. Two highlights from the evening were bringing back the memories of a former music instructor with dementia and enticing one woman who hadn't got out of bed for a long time to come to the lounge and listen to the music. Students also handed out Christmas cards and cookies made by students in the GIN Seeds of Growth exploration.
HPC International Evening at Halcyon
Date: Monday 12 December
Time: 1700-2000
Location: Halcyon
The HPC will be holding the annual school-wide cultural food-fest at Halcyon. This is a fun time to enjoy specialties from all over the world while catching up with parents over a glass of wine. We are asking for contributions in the form of food and child friendly activities. Please contact your Grade Representatives or Berna Hudson for information on how you can contribute to this celebration of our school.

Student activities will include virtual reality tours and a collaborative photo booth. Please direct your children to these apps which can be downloaded prior to the evening. Thanks to Jennifer Gupta for her invaluable skills in pulling this together.
Google Education on Air: #ItTakesATeacher
Over the weekend, tens of thousands of people from around the world tuned in to the world's largest online education technology conference: Google's ‘Education On Air’. As one of only 15 educators from the UK, Jon Neale delivered a session packed with tips and tricks. If you would like to view this or any of the other fantastic sessions, please visit here.
Student Scoring Success!
Well done to the students who won a one-sided match 12-1 to end the Halcyon Staff team's unbeaten record. The students showed excellent finishing ability and good stamina throughout the match.
A Halcyon Winter Wonderland
Date: Thursday 15 December
Time: 1515 - 1600
Students are holding a Winter Wonderland celebration at Halcyon and are inviting parents to participate or just support them by attending. 

There will be stalls, face painting, music, a woolly jumper competition and much more. All in aid of fundraising for Mary’s Meals, one of Halcyon’s designated charities.

If you would like to participate, whether it’s running a stall, bake sale, help decorate the hall or donate to the jumble sale, please email Joann Ranson or Lori Fritz who are helping the students with this fantastic event.

If you want to join us as a guest, we hope to see you in your best festive jumper and join in the fun!
HPC Staff Appreciation Breakfast
Date: Friday 16 December
Time: From 0830
As the winter break approaches the HPC will be demonstrating their gratitude for the Halcyon staff with our annual Staff Appreciation Breakfast. We kindly request the parent community to contribute breakfast foods in all forms. Food items should be dropped or sent in with your child(ren) the morning of Friday 16 December. Please help the HPC show the Halcyon staff how much we value their hard work and dedication. Thanks!
App Directory
Calendar
Directory
6. Connect With Us
Administrative Officer: Laura Olmedo | 020 7258 1169
Director: Barry Mansfield
IBMYP Coordinator: Lori Fritz
IBDP Coordinator: Pat Kyle
Student Wellbeing Leader: Gareth Jones
Digital Learning Leader: Jon Neale
